<div class="intro-text">
I’m a Data Science student at Baylor who loves building things with data.
My work sits at the intersection of research, real projects, and practical problem-solving.
I’ve developed tools and models in R and Python, worked on Bayesian network research using beta divergence,
built websites for organizations, and managed live sound production for large events.
I enjoy taking projects from idea to execution and collaborating with people across different roles
to turn messy data into clear, useful solutions.
Whether it’s research, web development, audio production, or analytics,
I’m driven by creating work that is both technically strong and meaningful in the real world.

  <section class="content-block">
    <h2>Research</h2>
    <p>
      My research focuses on Bayesian networks, chain event graphs, and alternative scoring methods using beta divergence. 
      I work in R to build custom scoring functions and test how network structures change under contamination and uncertainty. 
      This work connects theory with practical modeling and has led to posters, code repositories, and ongoing collaboration 
      with faculty mentors. I enjoy exploring how statistical ideas can be turned into usable tools for real data problems.
    </p>
